title.u: how to multiply using the calculator

shortdesc.i: Here you will find the instruction of multiply feature in JPS calculator app.

li.i: Basic knowledge of using a calculator application on your device.
A pre-existing monthly budget plan with the current expense amounts.

p.i: Multiply your monthly expenses by a specific factor, such as a percentage increase or a change in quantity, to update your budget plan using a calculator application.

cmd.i: Launch the calculator application on your device.
Identify the expenses you want to multiply by a factor.
Determine the factor to be applied (e.g., percentage increase, change in quantity)
Enter the original expense amount into the calculator
Select the multiplication symbol (typically represented by "x" or "Ã—") on the calculator.
Enter the factor value into the calculator.
Press the "=" button to calculate the new expense amount

result.i: The result from the multiplication is displayed.

li.i: Enter the original expense amount, which is $500.
Enter the factor value, which is 1.1 for a 10% increase.

p.i: Result: The calculator application will display the new expense amount, which in this case is $550. Therefore, after applying a 10% increase, the new expense amount is $550.
